MolCalculatorWindow.Title: Molar Mass Calculator
MolCalculatorWindow.SuccessMessageFormat: The molecule has a weight of {0} g/mol.
MolCalculatorWindow.Examples:
Valid input: NaHCO3, CH3COONH4, Ca3(PO4)2, Fe4(Fe(CN)6)3.
Please mind uppercase and lowercase letters.
Use only parenthesis to group compunds
If you need to use decimals, use a fraction: H1/2 is valid, H0.5 is not.

ReactionStoichiometryWindow.Title: Reaction's' Stoichiometry
ReactionStoichiometryWindow.SuccessMessageFormat: The limiting reactant is {0}, with a quantity of {1} equal to: {2} g.

StoichiometryInfoWindow.Title: How to use?
StoichiometryInfoWindow.Instructions:
1) Type the chemical reaction.
2) Select the target product to calculate the limitant reactant.
3) Write the amount of reactants in grams.
4) Press the calculate button.

To calculate the yield % just type in the last textbox the mass of the experimental product.
